channel.title: No one is able to join my server!
channel.description: I made a server and I am able to get into it but no1 else can. 1)I "tried" opening my ports "43594" 2)I disabled my firewall 3)I put my server into the "exceptions" tab. 4)I tried asking the owners of alot of different servers and they all told me 1 thing, "go to moparisthebest.com and click forums.

item.source: No one is able to join my server!

item.title: No one is able to join my server!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

bestpkerever:

I have WRT56GS and How would I properly port forward this?

First you need to know it’s IP on your network. To get that, go to Start -> Run -> Type ‘cmd’ -> When the command prompt window comes up, type ‘ipconfig’.

Once you do that, it will come up with a list of numbers in the command prompt window. You need the number next to ‘default gateway’.
Put that number in your web browser’s address bar and hit enter. Tell me how you go with that.

Wildfire:

Well, if you are stupid…Or your WRT54G router fucks up and won’t let you port forward…Whist;es There a new PvpScape out yet?

I stopped making PvpScape a long time ago.

Read full topic

item.title: No one is able to join my server!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

bestpkerever:

hamachi would solve my problems? and i do have a router

Hamachi is the easy way out. There are negatives with Hamachi though - think about it like this: When you port forward and set your computer up properly, people connect directly. When they use Hamachi, they connect through the Hamachi main server. Therefore, they’re making two connections, so whatever they do has to be sent through the Hamachi main server first.

At the end of the day in simple terms, Hamachi is definitely slower to use.

Read full topic

item.title: No one is able to join my server!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Heh, do you have a router? Because if you’ve done all that and it still doesn’t work, then chances are you haven’t set your router up to allow the connections to be forwarded to your computer.

In other words, you need to set up port forwarding in the router that I’m presuming you have.

EDIT: In future, put all of your questions in one topic - that would be much better then several topics.

Read full topic
